meanings.sent1: The sly fox hoodwinked the rabbit into sharing its carrots.
meanings.sent2: She felt hoodwinked when she realized the online offer was too good to be true.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat hoodwinked the dog by pretending to be invisible.
meanings.sent4: The con artist hoodwinked the old man out of his life savings.
meanings.sent5: The magician hoodwinked the audience with his disappearing act.

meanings.definition: To blindfold or cover the eyes of (someone)
meanings.sent1: During the game, they hoodwinked the player before leading them to the surprise party.
meanings.sent2: The kidnappers hoodwinked the victim to prevent them from seeing their location.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to hoodwink their friend as part of a playful prank.
meanings.sent4: The superhero was hoodwinked and temporarily blinded by the villain's flash grenade.
meanings.sent5: The spy hoodwinked the guard by pretending to be a maintenance worker.
